A businessman's plan to help former Memphis State athletes finish college has run afoul of National Collegiate Athletic Association regulations. Avron Fogelman, a Memphis real estate developer and co-owner of the Kansas City Royals, announced a plan in February to help pay the tuition of any former Memphis State athletes who have used up their playing eligibility but have not earned college degrees.
But N.C.A.A. officials said Thursday that the plan appears to violate regulations for financial aid to athletes.
